newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Wilson runs Highlands entitlements market.
newsitem.headline: Wilson runs Highlands entitlements market.

text.p: Brisbane-based stockbroker Wilson HTM Corporate Services Ltd said on Wednesday it was running off-market trading in entitlements to the A$190 million float of Papua New Guinea miner Highlands Pacific Ltd.
A Wilson HTM spokesman said the entitlements market began on Thursday last week and had managed trade in more than 215,000 entitlements at between 10 and 15 cents each.
The entitlements closed up four cents at 15 cents on Wednesday on trade of 105,852.

Highlands Pacific, which was born out of a restructure of Highlands Gold Ltd after a takeover bid by Canadian miner Placer Dome Inc, said last week it planned to offer 76.5 million shares to investors and institutions as part of its plan to raise A$190 million.

Under the Highlands Gold plan, Placer Dome would control Highlands Gold's 25 percent stake in the Porgera gold mine in PNG, while Highlands Pacific would buy the group's remaining assets in PNG and Indonesia.
Placer won control of Highlands Gold with a 75 cent a share offer.
Highlands Gold shareholders each have a three-for-10 entitlement to shares in the new company.
